links.title: PGSQL Replication Detail in seconds for Cluster ${cls}
PGSQL Replication lag in bytes for Cluster ${cls}

panels.description: Instances among this cluster and their saturation (postgres or pgbouncer)
panels.title: Instance

panels.description: Nodes of this cluster and their cpu usage.
panels.title: Node

panels.description: HAProxy and it's backend process count
panels.title: Proxy

panels.description: Database list and their numbers of backends
panels.title: Database

panels.description:
Overall pressure for this PostgreSQL Node and Instance. 
max(node:ins:cpu_usage, pg:ins:load, pgbouncer:ins:load)
Alerting event graph. Each stripe represent an alerting Event. Gray transparent stipe are pending alerts.
Replication Lag (WAL Replay Lag) measured in bytes
panels.title: Replication Lag

panels.description:
Average transaction response time from pgbouncer
(You can get from postgres directly after PG14)
panels.title: RT

panels.description: Number of backends for each instances among this cluster
panels.title: Session

panels.description: Total transactions (commit + rollback) per second from PostgreSQL in last 5 minutes
panels.title: Xacts

panels.description: Tuples fetched, inserted, updated, delete among this cluster
panels.title: CRUD

panels.description: Time spent per second for each query of each instances.
panels.title: Query Time Spent

panels.description: Ratio of XID used for each database among this cluster
panels.title: XID Usage

panels.description:
R▲ for disk read bandwidth
TX▲ for network transmit bandwidth
RX▼ for network receive bandwidth
W▼ for disk write bandwidth
panels.title: Disk / Network

value.title: PGSQL Instance for replication source instance ${__data.fields.SRC}
PGSQL Instance for replication destination instance ${__data.fields.DST}
